commentary: Cottrell to de Kock, no run pitched on a length, de Kock watches it go by

commentary: Cottrell to de Kock, no run short and wide, de Kock cuts but only finds the man at point

commentary: Cottrell to de Kock, no run full, driven to mid-on

commentary: Cottrell to de Kock, 1 run straighter, whipped to the onside for South Africa's first runs of the day
text: straighter, whipped to the onside for South Africa's first runs of the day

commentary: Cottrell to Amla, 2 runs Amla leans into an overpitched delivery that clears the offside field, and runs two off his first ball. Decent first over from Cottrell.
text: Amla leans into an overpitched delivery that clears the offside field, and runs two off his first ball. Decent first over from Cottrell.

commentary: Roach to de Kock, no run great delivery. Pitched on a length and moved away from the batsman, who, according to the umpire, edged it to the keeper, who takes an excellent one handed diving catch. de Kock has reviewed straightaway though, and it shows the ball came off his arm instead. Decision reversed.
shortText: Roach to de Kock, no run
text: great delivery. Pitched on a length and moved away from the batsman, who, according to the umpire, edged it to the keeper, who takes an excellent one handed diving catch. de Kock has reviewed straightaway though, and it shows the ball came off his arm instead. Decision reversed.

commentary: Roach to de Kock, no run shorter, wider, eased into the covers
shortText: Roach to de Kock, no run

commentary: Roach to de Kock, 1 run too straight this time, and glanced away to square leg. Amla to face Roach for the first time now
text: too straight this time, and glanced away to square leg. Amla to face Roach for the first time now

commentary: Roach to Amla, no run good ball first up to Amla, quick and wicket-to-wicket. Amla blocks
text: good ball first up to Amla, quick and wicket-to-wicket. Amla blocks

commentary: Roach to Amla, no run shorter, and came back into Amla, who just about fends it off
text: shorter, and came back into Amla, who just about fends it off

commentary: Roach to Amla, no run defended into the slips. One from an excellent over.

commentary: Cottrell to de Kock, no run defended
shortText: Cottrell to de Kock, no run
text: defended

commentary: Cottrell to de Kock, 3 runs short but de Kock pounced on it. Didn't nearly have the zip it required to trouble de Kock, who managed to clear the infield without quite finding perfect timing on it. It was a long chase for the fielder, and they run three.
text: short but de Kock pounced on it. Didn't nearly have the zip it required to trouble de Kock, who managed to clear the infield without quite finding perfect timing on it. It was a long chase for the fielder, and they run three.

commentary: Cottrell to Amla, FOUR runs a tempting half-volley for Amla, who leans into it effortlessly, guiding the ball past point for South Africa's first boundary of the morning
text: a tempting half-volley for Amla, who leans into it effortlessly, guiding the ball past point for South Africa's first boundary of the morning

commentary: Cottrell to Amla, no run closer to yorker length this time. Amla tries the same shot but it goes to a fielder on this occasion.
text: closer to yorker length this time. Amla tries the same shot but it goes to a fielder on this occasion.

commentary: Cottrell to Amla, OUT this is too easy for West Indies! Amla got done by a bit of extra pace and bounce. Far too late rising with the ball to meet the bounce. It rushed the batsman, clipping him on the gloves and spooning to the slip fielder. Comfortable catch, and South Africa lose their first.
text: this is too easy for West Indies! Amla got done by a bit of extra pace and bounce. Far too late rising with the ball to meet the bounce. It rushed the batsman, clipping him on the gloves and spooning to the slip fielder. Comfortable catch, and South Africa lose their first.

commentary: Cottrell to Markram, no run short, fended off. Great start for the West Indies, this
text: short, fended off. Great start for the West Indies, this

commentary: Roach to de Kock, 1 wide dragged much too far down the legside
text: dragged much too far down the legside

commentary: Roach to Markram, FOUR runs lovely shot, this may get Markram going. Full and slightly wide of the stumps. Markram steps into it, and transfers his weight beautifully through the ball, and just evades a diving Holder
text: lovely shot, this may get Markram going. Full and slightly wide of the stumps. Markram steps into it, and transfers his weight beautifully through the ball, and just evades a diving Holder

commentary: Cottrell to de Kock, 2 runs short and de Kock attacks once more. In the air for slightly longer than perhaps planned but never a catch candidate
text: short and de Kock attacks once more. In the air for slightly longer than perhaps planned but never a catch candidate

commentary: Cottrell to de Kock, no run this short ball troubled de Kock more. This one rose and got big on him, and the fend off from the left-handed scooped straight into the air. Much quicker, and de Kock wears an expression of alarm and surprise

commentary: Cottrell to de Kock, FOUR runs this is what de Kock is so good at! width at a comfortable pace, and the batsman latches on to it. Whipped through point and races for four. Productive over for South Africa for a change.

commentary: Roach to de Kock, 2 runs driven straight down for another couple. Three from a tight over

commentary: Cottrell to Markram, OUT and Cottrell snares another one! Targeting Markram with the short ball, into his ribs. The batsman tamely flicks it, trying to run it down to fine leg. Gets a slight tickle on to it instead, which a diving keeper pouches. Markram barely even waits for the decision, walking off in disgust
